article.title: JavaScript Function Closures #10
article.author: Iris Chew
article.excerpt: The code inside a function is not executed when the function is defined.The code inside a function is executed when the function is invoked. It is common to use the term "call a function" instead of "invoke a function".

authors.bio: Who from a digital marketer to front-end engineer.
authors.name: Iris Chew

next.author: Iris Chew
